alert.note: Alert for City of Richmond; Cumberland; Goochland; Henrico; Powhatan (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 16 at 10:55PM EDT until May 17 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT WEDNESDAY FOR NORTHEASTERN CUMBERLAND, SOUTHERN GOOCHLAND, WEST CENTRAL HENRICO AND POWHATAN COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF RICHMOND... At 1055 PM EDT, the public reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Richmond, Powhatan, Tuckahoe, Bon Air, University Of Richmond, Downtown Richmond, Virginia Commonwealth University, Virginia Union University, Mechanicsville, Macon, Sabot, Manakin, Trenholm, Lakeside, East Highland Park, Goodwins Store, Jefferson, Worshams, Fine Creek Mills and Provost. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Do not stay in areas subject to flooding when water begins rising. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: City of Richmond; Cumberland; Goochland; Henrico; Powhatan
